work.name: Technical University of Munich
work.summary: Delivered tutorial lectures and supported various courses.

Delivered tutorial lectures to over 180 students and independently created a complete set of lesson materials.

Assisted in preparing practice questions and supported professors with grading assignments and exam papers for courses including Algorithms, Programming Theory, Distributed Systems, Theory of Informatics, Numerical Programming, Linear Algebra, and Discrete Mathematics.

thesis.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
thesis.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.
